alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 5:28PM MST until July 26 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... the Tunnel and Pipeline Burn Scars in Coconino County, Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 523 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area over the Tunnel Fire Burn Scar and Pipeline Burn Scar near Doney Park. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Timberline, Doney Park, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument, Fernwood, Hutchison Acres, and Wupatki Trails. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 424 and 428. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... San Francisco Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
